intro: Gymnolomia calva var. lancifolia, commonly known as the lanceleaf gymnolomia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It has small, hairy stems and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss, this variant is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
